articles.title: Trump renews attacks on 'fake, fake disgusting news'
articles.description: President Donald Trump is renewing his campaign against the media, claiming at a Pennsylvania rally that the media is the “fake, fake disgusting news” and casting journalists as his true political opponent.

articles.author: Caitlin Doherty
articles.title: BREAKING: Emergency EVACUATIONS amid DAM BURST fears in Lynchburg, Virginia
articles.description: RESIDENTS are being evacuated amid fears of a dam bursting in Virginia, USA.

articles.author: Christal Hayes
articles.title: 'Completely tragic': Mother charged with murder after tossing 4-year-old daughter into Florida river, cops say
articles.description: A woman has been charged with murder after police say she tossed her four-year-old daughter into a Tampa, Florida river on Thursday.

articles.title: Top New Hampshire Democrat Arrested on Domestic Violence Charges
articles.description: Colleagues on both sides of the aisle have called for Jeff Woodburn, the State Senate minority leader who is up for re-election, to resign.

articles.author: Aamer Madhani, Scott Gleeson
articles.title: Chicago activists shutdown Lake Shore Drive, speak out against gun violence at Wrigley
articles.description: Protesters marched on the Windy City’s iconic Lake Shore Drive Thursday to express outrage over Chicago’s endemic gun violence and call for the resignation of Mayor Rahm Emanuel.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/michael-d-shear, http://www.nytimes.com/by/michael-wines
articles.title: Russian Threat 'Is Real,' Trump Officials Say, Vowing to Protect US Elections
articles.description: The leaders of the national security agencies promised to help state and local governments counter what they called Russia’s efforts to influence the elections.

articles.title: US hopes to resume joint field operations with North Korea to find war remains
articles.description: Military lab is beginning analysis of Korean War remains handed over in 55 boxes this week.

articles.author: Cristina Corbin
articles.title: Mollie Tibbetts search team scours land near Iowa pig farm
articles.description: Search teams on Thursday afternoon were combing through ditches near a pig farm that federal agents searched almost a week ago in the hunt for missing college student Mollie Tibbetts, after a possible clue to her disappearance -- a red shirt -- reportedly was…

articles.author: Alan Gomez
articles.title: Trump administration says ACLU — not government — should find deported parents
articles.description: The Trump administration is under a court order to reunite more than 2,500 children separated from their parents at the border, but Justice lawyers say advocacy groups should be responsible for finding parents who were deported.

articles.author: Elizabeth Gurdus
articles.title: Cramer Remix: Apple won't be the only company to hit $1 trillion
articles.description: Jim Cramer explains what makes Apple’s trillion dollar market cap so meaningful.

articles.title: Worker Charged With Sexually Molesting Eight Children at Immigrant Shelter
articles.description: The allegations against the Southwest Key youth care worker are the latest in a series of serious accusations of sexual abuse inside the government’s…

articles.title: Amber Alert issued after girl is abducted from Reagan National Airport
articles.description: Authorities are working with Virginia State Police and other agencies to find Jinjing Ma.

articles.title: FAQ: The latest on Ohio State's Urban Meyer investigation
articles.description: A guide to why coach Urban Meyer was placed on administrative leave and who the key players are in the investigation of assistant coach Zach Smith's domestic violence accusations.

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/coral-davenport
articles.title: Trump Administration Unveils Its Plan to Relax Car Pollution Rules
articles.description: The proposal would freeze rules requiring cleaner, more efficient cars and unravel one of President Obama’s signature policies to fight global warming.

articles.author: Elise Labott, CNN
articles.title: Suspected Russian spy caught working inside US embassy in Moscow
articles.description: A suspected Russian spy was employed for more than a decade at the US Embassy in Moscow before being fired last year, a senior administration official tells CNN.

articles.title: 'All I Did Was Be Black': Police Are Called on College Student Eating Lunch
articles.description: The Smith College student, Oumou Kanoute, had been sitting in a common area when a staff member reported her. The college’s president apologized.

articles.title: Officials: No 'real world' active shooter incident at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base
articles.description: Wright-Patterson Air Force Base has given the all clear after reports of an active shooter at the base medical center.

articles.title: Paul Manafort trial Day 3: Bookkeeper testifies about overseas accounts, cash flow problems, unpaid bills
articles.description: Updates from the courtroom where Trump's former campaign chairman is facing bank and tax fraud charges.

articles.author: Amy Held
articles.title: '20-Year-Old Grudge' May Have Led To Killing Of Houston Cardiologist, Police Say
articles.description: Mark Hausknecht was shot and killed by the son of a patient who died during surgery decades earlier, according to police. The suspect, identified as Joseph James Pappas, remains at large.

articles.author: Brian Flood
articles.title: New York Times stands by new tech writer Sarah Jeong after racist tweets surface
articles.description: The New York Times is under fire for adding Sarah Jeong to its editorial board as derogatory tweets sent from her Twitter account have been unearthed.
